The active ingredient in toothpaste is usually a mild abrasive such as calcium carbonate, silica, or baking soda. Other ingredients may include fluoride, which helps prevent tooth decay, and flavoring agents such as mint, to make the toothpaste more palatable.
Most toothpastes contain fluoride, which helps to prevent tooth decay by strengthening tooth enamel and reducing the amount of acid produced by bacteria in the mouth.
